Literature Review: Diet plays a crucial role in the maintenance of gastrointestinal (GI) health and the development of various GI disorders. Recent advances in microbiome research have highlighted the intricate relationship between diet, gut microbiota, and the pathophysiology of GI diseases. This review focuses on the role of diet-microbiome interactions in two prominent GI disorders: irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) and inflammatory bowel disease (IBD). We also explore strategies to modulate these interactions using microbiome-targeted therapies.
